thread.title: First 'council of the North' meeting to be held in Newcastle as leaders call for greater powers

author: Laura Hill
title: First 'council of the North' meeting to be held in Newcastle as leaders call for greater powers
text:
First 'council of the North' meeting to be held in Newcastle as leaders call for greater powers Political leaders of northern cities will unite to demand more power and cash from the Government Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Newcastle will play host to the first so-called council of the north meeting when political leaders gather for the Great Exhibition of the North next summer. 
This announcement comes as the leaders of major northern cities have agreed the need to bring together interests from across the north to call for more control from Whitehall. 
Leaders of Newcastle , Leeds, Liverpool, Leeds, Bradford, Sheffield and elsewhere have said the north needs a new way of pushing for a greater say over its own destiny and demand multi-billion pound investments. 
The group met on Tuesday in Leeds to discuss the next steps after a transport meeting last month which built on outrage caused when the government cancelled investment on railway lines across the north while signing off major new funds for London transport. Labour Councillor Nick Forbes 
The politicians aim to widen the group to include, councils, MPs, businesses and faith groups with the intention of holding its first meeting in Newcastle as the Great Exhibition for the North starts next year. 
Newcastle City Council leader Nick Forbes said he was pleased that the calls to rebalance the UK would come out of the North East. Read More Great ideas are being sought to make the Great Exhibition of the North truly... well, great 
He said: “Newcastle has a strong reputation as a campaigning city, as a city that fights for social justice and a fairer deal from government. 
“Leaders from across the north will be coming together to set out how government can work with us to genuinely rebalance the UK economy and make more of our strengths. 
“It is only natural that as Newcastle, Gateshead and the rest of the UK prepare to celebrate all that is great about the north, we set out our vision for a new relationship with government at the same time.” A view of Sage Gateshead and the Gateshead Millennium Bridge (Image: NewcastleGateshead Initiative) 
Northern leaders including Greater Manchester Mayor Andy Burnham have said northern cities must work together to secure national investment and also to celebrate and promote the successes of the north. 
It is thought that the first meeting of the convention would look to build on northern-wide concerns on transport investment while also looking to balance out London’s dominance in Brexit talks . Read More As Boris Johnson takes on Theresa May, is Brexit going horribly wrong? 
Coun Forbes said that the needs of the North risk being ignored in Brexit negotiations. 
He said: “Right now, our Brexit talks nationally are focused on what a handful of people in London think are our needs. 
“That is clearly wrong, and it is why I and other city leaders are coming together to challenge London’s dominance in setting the terms of the UK’s future prosperity. 
“Our northern cities, and the businesses that make them so strong, must have a voice that is heard in Brexit negotiations.” 
It was announced last year that Newcastle Gateshead will host the Great Exhibition of the North in July 2018. Like us on Facebook
